member.name: T:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationIndex
member.summary: A Classification Index is an ordered list (alphabetical, in code order etc) of Classification Index Entries. A Classification Index can relate to one particular or to several Statistical Classifications. A Classification Index shows the relationship between text found in statistical data sources (responses to survey questionnaires, administrative records) and one or more Statistical Classifications. A Classification Index may be used to assign the codes for Classification Items to observations in statistical collections.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationIndex.ItemType
member.summary: Gets the universally unique identifier representing the item's type.
member.value: The identifier representing the item's type.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationIndex.ReleaseDate
member.summary: Date when the current version of the Classification Index was released.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationIndex.MaintenanceUnit
member.summary: The unit or group of persons within the organization responsible for the Classification Index, i.e. for adding, changing or deleting Classification Index Entries.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationIndex.ContactPerson
member.summary: Person(s) who may be contacted for additional information about the Classification Index.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationIndex.Publications
member.summary: A list of the publications in which the Classification Index has been published.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationIndex.Languages
member.summary: A Classification Index can exist in several languages. Indicates the languages available. If a Classification Index exists in several languages, the number of entries in each language may be different, as the number of terms describing the same phenomenon can change from one language to another. However, the same phenomena should be described in each language. Language is expressed using standard RFC 1766 language codes (for example: fr, en) and may be extended with the use of specific locations (en-UK).

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationIndex.Corrections
member.summary: Summary description of corrections, which have occurred within the Classification Index. Corrections include changing the item code associated with a Classification Index Entry.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationIndex.CodingInstructions
member.summary: Additional information which drives the coding process for all entries in a Classification Index. Supports the use of multiple languages and structured content.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationIndex.Entries
member.summary: An ordered list (alphabetical, in code order etc.) of Classification Index Entries.

member.name: M:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationIndex.GetChildren
member.summary: Gets the identifiers of the item's children.
member.returns: The identifiers of the item's children.

member.name: M:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationIndex.ReplaceChild(Algenta.Colectica.Model.Utility.IdentifierTriple,Algenta.Colectica.Model.IVersionable)
member.summary: Replaces the child with the specified identifier with the provided item.
member.param: The identifier of the child to replace.
member.returns: The number of children replaced.

member.name: M:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationIndex.RemoveChild(Algenta.Colectica.Model.Utility.IdentifierTriple)
member.summary: Removes the specified child.
member.returns: The number of children removed from the item.

member.name: T:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationIndexEntry
member.summary: A Classification Index Entry is a word or a short text (e.g. the name of a locality, an economic activity or an occupational title) describing a type of object/unit or object property to which a Classification Item applies, together with the code of the corresponding Classification Item. Each Classification Index Entry typically refers to one item of the Statistical Classification. Although a Classification Index Entry may be associated with a Classification Item at any Level of a Statistical Classification, Classification Index Entries are normally associated with Classification Items at the lowest Level.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationIndexEntry.EntryText
member.summary: Text describing the type of object/unit or object property.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationIndexEntry.CodesClassificationItem
member.summary: The Classification Item with which the Classification Index Entry is associated.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationIndexEntry.ValidFrom
member.summary: Date from which the Classification Index Entry became valid.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationIndexEntry.ValidTo
member.summary: Date at which the Classification Index Entry became invalid.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationIndexEntry.CodingInstructions
member.summary: Additional information which drives the coding process. Required when coding is dependent upon one or many other factors.

member.name: T:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationCorrespondenceTable
member.summary: A Correspondence Table expresses the relationship between two Statistical Classifications. These are typically: two versions from the same Classification Series; Statistical Classifications from different Classification Series; a variant and the version on which it is based; different versions of a variant. In the first and last examples, the Correspondence Table facilitates comparability over time. Correspondence relationships are shown in both directions

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationCorrespondenceTable.ItemType
member.summary: Gets the universally unique identifier representing the item's type.
member.value: The identifier representing the item's type.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationCorrespondenceTable.Owners
member.summary: The statistical office, other authority or section that created and maintains the Correspondence Table.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationCorrespondenceTable.MaintenanceUnits
member.summary: The unit or group of persons who are responsible for the Correspondence Table, i.e. for maintaining and updating it.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationCorrespondenceTable.ContactPeople
member.summary: The person(s) who may be contacted for additional information about the Correspondence Table.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationCorrespondenceTable.Publications
member.summary: A list of the publications in which the Correspondence Table has been published.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationCorrespondenceTable.SourceClassification
member.summary: The Statistical Classification from which the correspondence is made.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationCorrespondenceTable.TargetClassification
member.summary: The Statistical Classification(s) to which the correspondence is directed. There may be multiple target Statistical Classifications associated with the Correspondence Table.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationCorrespondenceTable.SourceLevel
member.summary: The correspondence is normally restricted to a certain Level in the source Statistical Classification. In this case, target Classification Items are assigned only to source Classification Items on the given level. If no level is indicated, target Classification Items can be assigned to any Level of the source Statistical Classification.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationCorrespondenceTable.TargetLevel
member.summary: The correspondence is normally restricted to a certain Level in the target Statistical Classification. In this case, source Classification Items are assigned only to target Classification Items on the given Level. If no Level is indicated, source Classification Items can be assigned to any Level of the target Statistical Classification.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationCorrespondenceTable.RelationshipMapping
member.summary: A Correspondence Table can define a 1:1, 1:N, N:1 or M:N relationship between source and target Classification Items.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationCorrespondenceTable.FloatingMap
member.summary: If the source and/or target Statistical Classifications of a Correspondence Table are floating Statistical Classifications, the date of the Correspondence Table must be noted. The Correspondence Table expresses the relationships between the two Statistical Classifications as they existed on the date specified in the Correspondence Table.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationCorrespondenceTable.Maps
member.summary: The relationship between two Statistical Classifications. A Map is an expression of the relation between a Classification Item in a source Statistical Classification and a corresponding Classification Item in the target Statistical Classification. The Map should specify whether the relationship between the two Classification Items is partial or complete. Depending on the relationship type of the Correspondence Table, there may be several Maps for a single source or target Classification Item.

member.name: M:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationCorrespondenceTable.GetChildren
member.summary: Gets the identifiers of the item's children.
member.returns: The identifiers of the item's children.

member.name: M:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationCorrespondenceTable.ReplaceChild(Algenta.Colectica.Model.Utility.IdentifierTriple,Algenta.Colectica.Model.IVersionable)
member.summary: Replaces the child with the specified identifier with the provided item.
member.param: The identifier of the child to replace.
member.returns: The number of children replaced.

member.name: M:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationCorrespondenceTable.RemoveChild(Algenta.Colectica.Model.Utility.IdentifierTriple)
member.summary: Removes the specified child.
member.returns: The number of children removed from the item.

member.name: T:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationMap
member.summary: A Map is an expression of the relation between a Classification Item in a source Statistical Classification and a corresponding Classification Item in the target Statistical Classification. The Map should specify whether the relationship between the two Classification Items is partial or complete. Depending on the relationship type of the Correspondence Table, there may be several Maps for a single source or target Classification Item.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationMap.SourceItem
member.summary: The source item refers to the Classification Item in the source Statistical Classification.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationMap.TargetItem
member.summary: The target item refers to the Classification Item in the target Statistical Classification.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationMap.IsComplete
member.summary: Specifies whether the relationship between the two Classification Items is partial or complete.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationMap.ValidFrom
member.summary: Date from which the Map became valid. The date must be defined if the Map belongs to a floating Correspondence Table.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationMap.ValidTo
member.summary: Date at which the Map became invalid. The date must be defined if the Map belongs to a floating Correspondence Table and is no longer valid.

member.name: T:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification
member.summary: A Statistical Classification is a set of categories which may be assigned to one or more variables registered in statistical surveys or administrative files, and used in the production and dissemination of statistics. The categories at each level of the classification structure must be mutually exclusive and jointly exhaustive of all objects/units in the population of interest. The categories are defined with reference to one or more characteristics of a particular population of units of observation. A Statistical Classification may have a flat, linear structure or may be hierarchically structured, such that all categories at lower Levels are sub-categories of categories at the next Level up. Categories in Statistical Classifications are represented in the information model as Classification Items.

member.name: M:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.ItemType
member.summary: Gets the universally unique identifier representing the item's type.
member.value: The identifier representing the item's type.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.ReleaseDate
member.summary: Date on which the Statistical Classification was released.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.TerminationDate
member.summary: Date on which the Statistical Classification was superseded by a successor version or otherwise ceased to be valid.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.IsCurrent
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the Statistical Classification is currently valid.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.MaintenanceUnit
member.summary: The unit or group of persons within the organization who are responsible for the Statistical Classification (i.e, for maintaining, updating and changing it).

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.ContactPerson
member.summary: Person(s) who may be contacted for additional information about the Statistical Classification.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.LegalBase
member.summary: Indicates that the Statistical Classification is covered by a legal act or by some other formal agreement.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.Publications
member.summary: A list of the publications, including print, PDF, HTML and other electronic formats, in which the Statistical Classification has been published.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.Copyright
member.summary: Statistical Classifications may have restricted copyrights.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.IsDisseminationAllowed
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the Statistical Classification may be published or otherwise disseminated (e.g. electronic dissemination).

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.LevelContexts
member.summary: Level Context provides the depth of a Level within a Statistical Classification together with its membership. Both depth and membership can be specified per Statistical Classification.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.Index
member.summary: A Statistical Classification can be associated with one or a number of Classification Indexes in which Classification Index Entries are linked to the appropriate Classification Item. Include here links to any relevant Classification Indexes.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.IsVersion
member.summary: Indicates if the Statistical Classification is a version.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.IsUpdate
member.summary: Indicates if the Statistical Classification is a version.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.IsFloating
member.summary: Indicates if the Statistical Classification is a floating classification. In a floating statistical classification, a validity period should be defined for all Classification Items which will allow the display of the item structure and content at different points of time.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.Predecessor
member.summary: For those Statistical Classifications that are versions or updates, notes the preceding Statistical Classification of which the actual Statistical Classification is the successor.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.Successor
member.summary: Notes the Statistical Classification that superseded the actual Statistical Classification.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.DerivedFrom
member.summary: A Statistical Classification can be derived from one of the classification versions of another Classification Series. The derived Statistical Classification can either inherit the structure of the classification version from which it is derived, usually adding more detail, or use a large part of its Classification Items, rearranging them in a different structure. Indicates the classification version from which the actual Statistical Classification is derived.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.ChangesFromPreceding
member.summary: A summary description of the nature and content of changes from the preceding version or update.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.UpdatesAllowed
member.summary: Indicates whether or not updates are allowed within the classification version i.e. without leading to a new version.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.PermissibleUpdates
member.summary: If Updates are Allowed, Indicate here what structural changes, if any, are permissible within a version. Note whether Classification Items can be added to the structure and whether they can be revalidated or invalidated. Such changes are more likely to be permissible in floating classifications. Also indicate whether changes to such things as Classification Item names and explanatory notes that do not involve structural changes are permissible within a version.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.Updates
member.summary: Summary description of changes which have occurred since the most recent classification version or classification update came into force.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.VariantOf
member.summary: For those Statistical Classifications that are variants, notes the Statistical Classification on which it is based and any subsequent versions of that Statistical Classification to which it is also applicable.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.VariantChangesFromBase
member.summary: Describes the relationship between the variant and its base Statistical Classification, including regrouping, aggregations added and extensions.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.StatisticalClassification.VariantPurpose
member.summary: If the Statistical Classification is a variant, notes the specific purpose for which it was developed.

member.name: T:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationItem
member.summary: A Classification Item represents a Category at a certain Level within a Statistical Classification. It defines the content and the borders of the category. An object/unit can be classified to one and only one Classification Item at each Level of a Statistical Classification.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationItem.ItemType
member.summary: Gets the universally unique identifier representing the item's type.
member.value: The identifier representing the item's type.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationItem.Value
member.summary: Item Code - A Classification Item is identified by an alphabetical, numerical or alphanumerical code, which is in line with the code structure of the Level. The code is unique within the Statistical Classification to which the Classification Item belongs.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationItem.DefiningConcepts
member.summary: Gets or sets the concept that defines this unit type.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationItem.Includes
member.summary: Specifies the contents of the category.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationItem.IncludesAlso
member.summary: A list of borderline cases, which belong to the described category.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationItem.Excludes
member.summary: A list of borderline cases, which do not belong to the described category. Excluded cases may contain a reference to the Classification Items to which the excluded cases belong.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationItem.ExcludesClassificationItems
member.summary: References to the Classification Items to which the excluded cases belong.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationItem.IsGenerated
member.summary: Indicates whether or not the Classification Item has been generated to make the Level to which it belongs complete.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationItem.IsValid
member.summary: If updates are allowed in the Statistical Classification, a Classification Item may be restricted in its validity, i.e. it may become valid or invalid after the Statistical Classification has been released. Indicates whether or not the Classification Item is currently valid.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationItem.ValidFrom
member.summary: Date from which the Classification Item became valid. The date must be defined if the Classification Item belongs to a floating Statistical Classification.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationItem.ValidTo
member.summary: Date at which the Classification Item became invalid. The date must be defined if the Classification Item belongs to a floating Statistical Classification and is no longer valid.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationItem.FutureEvents
member.summary: The future events describe a change (or a number of changes) related to an invalid Classification Item. These changes may e.g. have turned the now invalid Classification Item into one or several successor Classification Items. In describing these changes, terminology from the Typology of item changes, found in GSIM Appendix 3 should be used. This allows the possibility to follow successors of the Classification Item in the future.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationItem.SuccessorItems
member.summary: Future events may e.g. have turned the now invalid Classification Item into one or several successor Classification Items, listed here.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationItem.ChangesFromPriorVersion
member.summary: Describes the changes, which the Classification Item has been subject to from the previous version to the actual Statistical Classification.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationItem.Updates
member.summary: Describes the changes, which the Classification Item has been subject to during the life time of the actual Statistical Classification.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationItem.Parent
member.summary: The Classification Item at the next higher Level of the Statistical Classification of which the actual Classification Item is a sub item.

member.name: T:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationLevel
member.summary: A Statistical Classification has a structure which is composed of one or several Levels. A Level often is associated with a concept, which defines it. In a hierarchical Statistical Classification the Classification Items of each Level but the highest are aggregated to the nearest higher Level. A linear Statistical Classification has only one Level.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationLevel.ItemType
member.summary: Gets the universally unique identifier representing the item's type.
member.value: The identifier representing the item's type.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationLevel.LevelTypeCode
member.summary: Indicates whether the code at the Level is alphabetical, numerical or alphanumerical.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationLevel.LevelCodeStructure
member.summary: Indicates how the code at the Level is constructed of numbers, letters and separators.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.ClassificationLevel.DummyCode
member.summary: Rule for the construction of dummy codes from the codes of the next higher Level (used when one or several categories are the same in two consecutive Levels).

member.name: T:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.UnitType
member.summary: A Unit Type is a class of objects of interest. A Unit Type is used to describe a class or group of Units based on a single characteristic with no specification of time and geography. For example, the Unit Type of Person groups together a set of Units based on the characteristic that they are Persons. It concerns not only Unit Types used in dissemination, but anywhere in the statistical process. For example, using administrative data might involve the use of a fiscal unit. Object class (ISO 11179) is a synonym of UnitType. [GSIM 1.2]

member.name: T:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.Level
member.summary: Used to describe the levels of the code scheme hierarchy. The level describes the nesting structure of a hierarchical coding structure. A level could have data attached to it (summary of its children) or no data attached to it (the equivalent of creating a category group in 2.0 and earlier versions Note that the attribute levelNumber is used for referencing specific codes to their level identifier.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.Level.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the level.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.Level.Description
member.summary: Gets a description of the level.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.Level.LevelNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the level number.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.Level.RelationshipType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the relationship among items in this level.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.Level.DisplayLabel
member.summary: Gets the display label used when a list of levels is displayed.

member.name: T:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.RelationshipType
member.summary: Describes the relationships among categories at a particular level.
member.remarks: Note that different levels may have different types of relationships within the same hierarchy. For example, Level 1 items may be ordinal and Level 2 (the children of Level 1 items) may be nominal.

member.name: F:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.RelationshipType.Nominal
member.summary: A relationship of less than, or greater than, cannot be established among the included categories. This type of relationship is also called categorical or discrete.

member.name: F:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.RelationshipType.Ordinal
member.summary: The categories in the domain have a rank order.

member.name: F:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.RelationshipType.Interval
member.summary: The categories in the domain are in rank order and have a consistent interval between each category so that differences between arbitrary pairs of measurements can be meaningfully compared.

member.name: F:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.RelationshipType.Ratio
member.summary: The categories have all the features of interval measurement and also have meaningful ratios between arbitrary pairs of numbers.

member.name: F:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.RelationshipType.Continuous
member.summary: May be used to identify both interval and ratio classification levels, when more precise information is not available.

member.name: T:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.CodeList
member.summary: Provides a description of a set of categories that have a specific relationship, such as the categories Male and Female that can be grouped together as Gender. Categories (e.g., Male and Female) can belong to multiple code lists. The code list also provides the unique code values for each of the categories in the code list.

member.name: P:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.LogicalRecord.HasLocator
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance has locator used to determine the record type.
member.remarks: When multiple types of records are stored in the same file, a locator variable is often used to determine which record type is specified. For example, a locator variable may contain "H" for a household record or "P" for a person record. If possible, consider structuring your data so a single record contains data for a single analysis unit.
member.value: true if this instance has locator; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Algenta.Colectica.Model.Ddi.Serialization.DdiValidator
member.summary: Provides methods to validate a DDI 3 XML instance against the DDI 3 schemas.
member.remarks: This currently validates against the DDI 3.1 schemas. When DDI 3.2 is released, this class will be updated to allow validating against either schema.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use a concise bounded description for serialization or deserialization.
member.remarks: When a concise bounded description (CBD) is used during serialization, child elements are not included inline. Instead, a reference to the item is written.
member.value: true if a concise bounded description should be used; otherwise, false.
